org.springframework.integration.support.management

Class DefaultMessageChannelMetrics

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.integration.support.management.AbstractMessageChannelMetrics
      • org.springframework.integration.support.management.DefaultMessageChannelMetrics
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConfigurableMetrics
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AggregatingMessageChannelMetrics

    public class DefaultMessageChannelMetrics
extends AbstractMessageChannelMetrics
    Default implementation; use the full constructor to customize the moving averages.
    Since:
    2.0
    Author:
    Dave Syer, Helena Edelson, Gary Russell, Ivan Krizsan

    • Constructor Detail

      • DefaultMessageChannelMetrics

        public DefaultMessageChannelMetrics()

      • DefaultMessageChannelMetrics

        public DefaultMessageChannelMetrics(String name)
        Construct an instance with default metrics with window=10, period=1 second, lapsePeriod=1 minute.
        Parameters:
        name - the name.

      • DefaultMessageChannelMetrics

        public DefaultMessageChannelMetrics(String name,
                                    ExponentialMovingAverage sendDuration,
                                    ExponentialMovingAverageRate sendErrorRate,
                                    ExponentialMovingAverageRatio sendSuccessRatio,
                                    ExponentialMovingAverageRate sendRate)
        Construct an instance with the supplied metrics. For proper representation of metrics, the supplied sendDuration must have a factor=1000000. and the the other arguments must be created with the millis constructor argument set to true.
        Parameters:
        name - the name.
        sendDuration - an ExponentialMovingAverage for calculating the send duration.
        sendErrorRate - an ExponentialMovingAverageRate for calculating the send error rate.
        sendSuccessRatio - an ExponentialMovingAverageRatio for calculating the success ratio.
        sendRate - an ExponentialMovingAverageRate for calculating the send rate.
        Since:
        4.2

        public MetricsContext beforeSend()
        Description copied from class: AbstractMessageChannelMetrics
        Begin a send event.
        Specified by:
        beforeSend in class AbstractMessageChannelMetrics
        Returns:
        the context to be used in a subsequent AbstractMessageChannelMetrics.afterSend(MetricsContext, boolean) call.

      • afterSend

        public void afterSend(MetricsContext context,
                      boolean result)
        Description copied from class: AbstractMessageChannelMetrics
        End a send event. Note that implementations typically will not validate that the context is of the correct type and not null; callers should take care to ensure the context is the object returned by the previous AbstractMessageChannelMetrics.beforeSend() call.
        Specified by:
        afterSend in class AbstractMessageChannelMetrics
        Parameters:
        context - the context.
        result - true for success, false otherwise.
